title: Your team isn't always bad
body:
This happens so often and it boggles my mind.

If you are going ham like 8/0 and someone else on your team is doing poorly, maybe 0/3 or worse. Don't immediately accuse them of feeding and flame them out of the game. If you are better than your opponent and crushing them, can you not figure out that the enemy might also have someone who's better than their opponent.

I played in bronze to help my friend get out a while back and every game they would flame their adc for being bad, complain about how god awful their botlane is and the like but never once did someone admit that I was better than theirs

Nobody is ever willing to admit that someone on the enemy team is just better, it's always "We could have won but we got the trash bot that fed you. GG" or "You suck dick but our adc just trolled all game so now u win"

It's such a toxic environment and it must ruin the game for so many people.

replies.body:
Of course, many people won't admit that someone else is better than them!
But sometimes it isn't hard to see who got outplayed, and who is... _lacking_.. in certain departments.

Personally, I don't judge my teammates on how well they execute plays, or how many kills they have _(I've seen complete potatoes end with 15+ kills.)_.
I judge them on their reading of the game and decision making.

For example if our Teemo top loses to a Nasus, I am more likely to just think that Nasus just outplayed him and is a really good player, I wont judge Teemo for it.
But if we are a team with no tanks at all, and he still last-picked Teemo top, then I'm more inclined to think of him as a bad player. 

Likewise if our jungler is 0/6 I don't judge him, we all get bad games!. But if he is mucking around with raptors while mid turret is being taken, then Ill start questioning his ability.

I wont be toxic to them of course, but ill give myself a mental note not to assume that they have my back, so I wont take risks I otherwise would take with a team I trust.

it becomes and entirely different manner however if your jungler gets executed more than once by a jungle camp. Once is excusable, you could lag or something, a 2s dc while clearing raptors while you were on sketchy health can get you killed, but more than that and there is something wrong.

If you are better than your opponent and crushing them, can you not figure out that the enemy might also have someone who&#039;s better than their opponent.

That's right. And because you are going ham and 8-0, it is now YOUR RESPONSIBILITY to carry the team. If you fail YOU LOST THE GAME, not your teammates. If you now jack around and get all cocky and don't PLAY TO WIN THE GAME, and you throw, it's YOUR FAULT. YOU LOST. YOU. Seen so many Yasuos and Lee Sins do this. Get ahead but have no clue how to win the game. Kinda because their champion needs to understand some assemblance of macro play or else it's useless.

> Nobody is ever willing to admit that someone on the enemy team is just better, it's always "We could have won but we got the trash bot that fed you." "GG" or "You suck dick but our adc just trolled all game so now u win"
> 
> It's such a toxic environment and it must ruin the game for so many people.

Yeah, it's terrible how people they just don't give praise anymore, or take responsibility enough to admit that they themselves need to improve. It's always a blame game, typical yank culture influences kids via the internet. Imagine Shane Warne bowling a no-ball that hits the stumps and then going off on a massive rage at how bad the upstairs review panel is, and it's all their fault that he didn't get the wicket... LOL.

I was on a smurf playing normals this morning and stole a dragon with a Janna Q and all the enemy adc could do was rage at his team, when supposedly they themselves were platinum and didn't put their efforts into carrying the game, and they spent all of their time flaming in all chat. Going off at bad players does nothing to help them improve at the game. After the game, I gave them some pointers to the ones that listened (most didn't).

"Kids are bad and they need to know it." - Tyler1
Its even worse when the enemy who is better than you is a higher elo :(
It's not necessarily that they are fucking bad it's that they don't/won't and can't adapt to the situation.

Problem is, and I'm assuming you saw this while playing, A LOT of the players will sit there and let the enemies beat them senseless for a free kill. 
Multiple times, a game.
Over multiple games. 
For fun.

Because they gave up 5 minutes in because {{{some made up excuse}}} usually consisting of "jungler never ganks so screw this team, he and {{{another role}}} doesnt deserve the win".

I'll be an example. I'll sit safely at top but I'll get dived and a 2-3 top permanantly per game without any assistence and I give up. Can't help but to, it's obvious our jungler and mids AFK. 
And when I support, the ADC either refuses to do anything, or is afk, or is just stupid enough to focus the tank while I beatstick the ADC.

Sometimes, they are just horrible to the point they should uninstall. 


Example;
I had a game the last night where the Cait was refusing to do anything because "Braum does no damage but takes no damage". Yes, that was the excuse. I fell behind. We got to grouping and only 2 would follow up and we'd nail it. Get lotsa kills, blow people up, was awesome. Cait still afk because "BURAMS NUT WIT MEH".

Again, sometimes they are just horrible and should uninstall.
